page.title: 14Johnson's Wax, Frimley Green
page.content: This company provides much employment for people in this area. Founded in 1886 in Racine, Wisconsin, U.S.A., Samuel Curtis Johnson bought a parquet flooring business and two years later began to make wax pastes to help people keep their floors in good condition. From 1914 the business concentrated on production of wax polishes, discontinuing the manufacture of floors. In that year Johnson's Wax came to Britain. Eventually the first purpose-built factory was completed in Frimley in 1960, on 66 acres of farmland and marshland. It has been extended several times. Employees are well catered for at work and in leisure time, and care has been taken to blend the factory into the surrounding area.
